sentences.sContent: If everyone could climb the mast of the regime, there would be no privileges.
sentences.sContent_eng: If everyone could climb the mast of the regime, there would be no privileges.
sentences.sCn: 如果每个人都可以攀登政权的桅杆摘彩的时候，那就没有什么特权了。

sentences.sContent: While a ketch offers these advantages to cruisers, they may also be more expensive because of the added mast and sail.
sentences.sContent_eng: While a ketch offers these advantages to cruisers, they may also be more expensive because of the added mast and sail.
sentences.sCn: 尽管双桅帆给水手们提供了这些优势，它们也因为这额外的桅杆和船帆而造价更加昂贵。

phrases.pCn: ◎在前桅的前部分，在艏；在艏楼

trans.tranOther: a tall pole on which the sails or flags on a ship are hung
